content.text:
# List of invasions in the 21st century

This is a list of military invasions that occurred or are still ongoing in the 21st century.
List
{| class="wikitable" width=100%
! Invasion

! Defending forces

|2024 invasion of Syria
|
|
Syrian protesters
----

| colspan="3" |Part of the Syrian Civil War – On 8 December, Israel launched an invasion of Syria after the fall of the Syrian Arab Republic

|2024 invasion of Lebanon
|
|
|-

|-
|2024 invasion of Kursk
|
|
|-
| colspan="3" |Part of the Russo-Ukrainian War – On 6 August, Ukraine launched a military invasion of Kursk Oblast. The largest settlement captured by Ukraine was Sudzha. North Korea sent forces to assist Russia starting in November 2024.

| 2022 al-Shabaab invasion of Ethiopia
|  Al-Shabaab
|
|- class="expand-child"
| colspan="3" style=" border-bottom: 1px solid black;|Part of the Ethiopian–Somali conflict and Somali civil war – On 20 July, the Al-Shabaab militant group launched an invasion of Ethiopia’s Somali Region from Somalia. The invasion was the largest attack by al-Shabaab in Ethiopian territory to date.

*Eastern

|  Donetsk PR Luhansk PR
|
|- class="expand-child"
| colspan="3" style=" border-bottom: 1px solid black;|Part of the Russo-Ukrainian War – On 24 February, Russia launched a full-scale military invasion of Ukraine. The invasion became the largest attack on a European country since World War II. It is estimated to have caused tens of thousands of Ukrainian civilian casualties and hundreds of thousands of military casualties. By June 2022, Russian troops occupied about 20% of Ukrainian territory and established military or military-civilian administrations in several regions and cities.
|-

|2001 invasion of Afghanistan
|  Northern Alliance
|  Al-Qaeda Islamic Movement of Uzbekistan Tehreek-e-Nafaz-e-Shariat-e-Mohammadi Jama'at al-Tawhid wal-Jihad
|- class="expand-child"
| colspan="3" style=" border-bottom: 1px solid black;|Part of the War in Afghanistan – Following the September 11 attacks, the United States declared the beginning of the war on terror. This subsequently led a multinational invasion of Taliban-ruled Afghanistan, which started on 7 October 2001. The goal of the invasion was to dismantle al-Qaeda, which had executed the attacks under the leadership of Osama bin Laden, and to deny Islamist militants a safe base of operations in Afghanistan by toppling the Taliban government. The capital city of Afghanistan, Kabul, was captured by the coalition on 13 November and the Taliban government collapsed on 17 December.
|}
